str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Fourteenth. From tessares and kai and dekatos; fourteenth.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From dia and phero; to bear through, i.e. transport; usually to bear apart, i.e. to toss about; subjectively, to 'differ', or surpass.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sailor, seaman. From naus; a boatman, i.e. Seaman.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To conjecture, suppose, suspect, deem. From hupo and noieo; to think under, i.e. To surmise or conjecture.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pros and ago; to lead towards, i.e. to conduct near, or to approach.
Feminine of a derivative of the base of chasma through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. A space of territory.
